contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=January 2013}} {{inline|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox cricketer | name = Julia Price | image = Cricket_no_pic.png | country = Australia | batting = Right-hand batsman | bowling = - | deliveries = balls | columns = 2 | column1 = [[Test cricket|Tests]] | matches1 = 10 | runs1 = 114 | bat avg1 = 19.00 | 100s/50s1 = 0/1 | top score1 = 80* | deliveries1 = - | wickets1 = - | bowl avg1 = - | fivefor1 = - | tenfor1 = - | best bowling1 = - | catches/stumpings1 = 20/2 | column2 = [[One Day International|ODIs]] | matches2 = 84 | runs2 = 365 | bat avg2 = 15.86 | 100s/50s2 = 0/0 | top score2 = 38 | deliveries2 = 6 | wickets2 = - | bowl avg2 = - | fivefor2 = - | tenfor2 = n/a | best bowling2 = - | catches/stumpings2 = 70/30 | date = 19 February | year = 2008 | source = http://content-usa.cricinfo.com/australia/content/player/53455.html Cricinfo }} '''Julia Clare Price''' (born 11 January 1972) is a [[cricket]]er for the [[Australia national women's cricket team|Australian women's cricket team]]. She made her first class debut in 1995 for Queensland Women and her [[Women's Test cricket|Test]] debut against [[New Zealand national women's cricket team|New Zealand]] at [[Melbourne]] in February 1996. Her last Test, so far, was against [[England women's cricket team|England]] at [[Worcester]] in 2005. A right-handed [[batsman]] she has scored 114 runs at Test level with her best [[innings]] an outstanding unbeaten 80 against England . A specialist [[wicket-keeper]], she has taken 20 catches and completed two stumpings in Tests. Nine of her Tests have been in [[The Women's Ashes|Ashes]] games against England, her other Test opponent being New Zealand. She has played 84 [[Women's One-day International cricket|One-day internationals]] for her country, scoring 365 runs at an average of 15.86 with her top score of 38 coming against the [[Ireland women's cricket team|Ireland]] Women's team. She has also bowled one over in ODIs, without success. She was a member of the Australian teams which won the [[Women's Cricket World Cup]] in 1997, beating New Zealand, and 2005, beating the [[India national women's cricket team|Indian]] team. She was a losing finalist in 2000 when New Zealand took the crown. With the emergence of [[Jodie Purves]] as a young wicket keeper for [[Queensland Fire]], Julia Price often plays now as a specialist middle order batsman for her state. In 89 matches in the [[Women's National Cricket League]] she has scored 1,812 runs, with a best of 112* against Western Australia Women, at an average of 23.84. She has scored eight other fifties and taken 78 catches and completed 23 stumpings. ==External links== *[http://www.cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/4/4758/4758.html Cricket Archive page on Julia Price] *[http://content-www.cricinfo.com/ci/content/player/53455.html?index=story Cricinfo page on Julia Price] {{Australia Squad 2005 Women's Cricket World Cup}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Price, Julia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Cricketer | DATE OF BIRTH = 11 January 1972 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Price, Julia}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian women cricketers]] [[Category:Australia women Test cricketers]] [[Category:Australia women One Day International cricketers]] [[Category:Cricketers from Sydney]] {{Australia-cricketbio-stub}}
